original: @175b * // dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i 'grel pa bzhugs /
analyzed: @175b * // dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i 'grel pa bzhugs /

original: # // dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i 'grel pa rgya las bsgyur ba /
analyzed: # // dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka'i 'grel pa rgya las bsgyur ba /
translated: Commentary on the Lotus Sutra, translated from the Chinese

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: mdo sde 'di bshad pa la don rnam pa bzhis dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di bshad pa la don rnam pa bzhis dbye bar bya ste /
translated: In explaining this sutra, it should be divided into four topics:

original: mdo sde bshad pa'i gleng gzhi dang / mdo sde 'di'i le'u rnams kyi don bstan pa dang / le'u rnams kyi go rims bstan pa dang / gzhung dgrol ba dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: mdo sde bshad pa'i gleng gzhi dang / mdo sde 'di'i le'u rnams kyi don bstan pa dang / le'u rnams kyi go rims bstan pa dang / gzhung dgrol ba dang bzhi'o //
translated: The introduction to the explanation of the sutra, the teaching on the meaning of the chapters of this sutra, the teaching on the sequence of the chapters, and the fourth is the explanation of the text.

original: mdo 'di'i gleng gzhi yang don rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mdo 'di'i gleng gzhi yang don rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The introduction to this sutra also has five meanings:

original: gleng gzhi dang / gleng slong ba dang / the tshom du 'dzin pa bsal ba dang / lung ston pa'i spyod pa bstan pa dang / tshe 'di dang gzhan du phan gdags pa'i don bstan pa dang / dus dang dbang po bstan pa dang lnga'o//
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang / gleng slong ba dang / the tshom du 'dzin pa bsal ba dang / lung ston pa'i spyod pa bstan pa dang / tshe 'di dang gzhan du phan gdags pa'i don bstan pa dang / dus dang dbang po bstan pa dang lnga'o//
translated: The introduction, the raising of the question, dispelling doubts, teaching the conduct of the prediction, teaching the meaning of benefiting this life and the next, and teaching the time and faculties - these five.

original: gleng gzhi la yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi la yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The introduction also has five aspects:

original: spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / tshol ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / ltas dang lnga'o //
analyzed: spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / tshol ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / ltas dang lnga'o //
translated: The five are: practice, aspiration, seeking, grasping, and signs.

original: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas su grub pa'ang spyod pa dam pa dang ldan pas gdod 'grub /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas su grub pa'ang spyod pa dam pa dang ldan pas gdod 'grub /
translated: The accomplishment of unsurpassed Buddhahood is accomplished only through possessing the highest practice.

original: spyod pa'ang smon lam gyis bstang dgos /
analyzed: spyod pa'ang smon lam gyis bstang dgos /
translated: Practice must also be purified by aspiration.

original: spyod pa dang smon lam du ldan yang 'bad pa dang bcas pas tshol zhing 'dzin na gdod 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod pa dang smon lam du ldan yang 'bad pa dang bcas pas tshol zhing 'dzin na gdod 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one possesses practice and aspiration, if one seeks and grasps with effort, one will only attain the result later.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas 'gro ba mang po'i don mdzad par dgongs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas 'gro ba mang po'i don mdzad par dgongs te /
translated: Thinking to benefit many beings through the perfect result,

original: mdo sde zab mo 'di bshad pa'i ltas chen po ston to //
analyzed: mdo sde zab mo 'di bshad pa'i ltas chen po ston to //
translated: the great signs of explaining this profound sutra are shown.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du 'byung ba yang don chen po gcig gi phyir 'byung zhes bya ba yang de'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du 'byung ba yang don chen po gcig gi phyir 'byung zhes bya ba yang de'o //
translated: The arising of the Buddha Bhagavans in the world is also for the sake of one great purpose.

original: de la spyod pa'i gzhi yang thabs mkhas pa'i le'u las mdo sde 'di'i 'grel pa su ba na dhus zab mo brgyad bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de la spyod pa'i gzhi yang thabs mkhas pa'i le'u las mdo sde 'di'i 'grel pa su ba na dhus zab mo brgyad bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The basis of practice is also as explained in the chapter on skillful means, in Subha's commentary on this sutra, which teaches the eight profundities.

original: sngon sangs rgyas mang po grangs med pa la rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byas te /
analyzed: sngon sangs rgyas mang po grangs med pa la rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byas te /
translated: In the past, they served and venerated many buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa dang / spyod pa grangs med pa la brtson pa dang grags pa phun sum tshogs pas zab mo sngon ma byung ba'i chos chud par dka' ba de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis dgongs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa dang / spyod pa grangs med pa la brtson pa dang grags pa phun sum tshogs pas zab mo sngon ma byung ba'i chos chud par dka' ba de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis dgongs te /
translated: and they were diligent in the countless deeds and conduct of the blessed buddhas. With their perfect fame, they were able to understand the profound, unprecedented Dharma that is difficult to comprehend.

original: so so'i yid dang mthun par ston pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: so so'i yid dang mthun par ston pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes par mi nus te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One taught in accordance with the individual minds of his disciples, but this Dharma cannot be understood by ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa shin tu zab pa dang / klog cing 'don pa shin tu zab pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa shin tu zab pa dang / klog cing 'don pa shin tu zab pa ste /
translated: It is extremely profound in terms of the apprehended and the apprehender, and it is extremely profound in terms of reading and recitation.

original: spyod pa shin tu zab pa dang / 'bras bu shin tu zab pa dang / bsod nams spel pa'i sems shin tu zab pa dang / don dam pa la mos pa'i sems shin tu zab pa dang / bla na med pa shin tu zab pa dang /
analyzed: spyod pa shin tu zab pa dang / 'bras bu shin tu zab pa dang / bsod nams spel pa'i sems shin tu zab pa dang / don dam pa la mos pa'i sems shin tu zab pa dang / bla na med pa shin tu zab pa dang /
translated: It is extremely profound in terms of conduct, extremely profound in terms of fruition, extremely profound in terms of the mind that increases merit, extremely profound in terms of the mind that aspires to the ultimate, extremely profound in terms of the unsurpassed,

original: 'jug pa shin tu zab pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa shin tu zab pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa shin tu zab pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa shin tu zab pa ste /
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is very profound, in terms of its engagement, its non-engagement, and its very profound unsharedness.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa 'di dag sangs rgyas @176a * //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyi spyod pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa 'di dag sangs rgyas @176a * // bcom ldan 'das kyi spyod pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas is very profound, because it is superior to the conduct of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.üîΩThis very profound conduct of the bodhisattvas is taught in order to complete all the conduct of the BhagavƒÅn Buddhas.

original: theg pa gcig pa'i spyod pa dang ldan zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu grub pas bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa de'i gleng gzhi'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos 'di ston to //
analyzed: theg pa gcig pa'i spyod pa dang ldan zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu grub pas bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa de'i gleng gzhi'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir dam pa'i chos 'di ston to //
translated: It is endowed with the conduct of the One Vehicle and, by establishing the cause of omniscience, it causes the attainment of the unsurpassed result.

original: de la smon lam gyi rgyu ni yang thabs mkhas pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de la smon lam gyi rgyu ni yang thabs mkhas pa'i le'u las /
translated: The cause of the bodhisattvas‚Äô conduct is taught in the chapter on skillful means.

original: sh'a ri'i bu nga sngon gyi dus na sems can thams cad dang bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su grub par bya'o zhes smon lam btab pas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu nga sngon gyi dus na sems can thams cad dang bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su grub par bya'o zhes smon lam btab pas /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, in the past, I made the aspiration, ‚ÄúI will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: smon lam de nyid grub ste /
analyzed: smon lam de nyid grub ste /
translated: That aspiration was fulfilled.

original: sems can dgrol ba la mnga' brnyes pa dang / sngon gyi dus na dam bcas shing smon lam btab pa de nyid spyod pa dang 'bras bu mthun par gyur pa bzhin sems can thams cad kyang spyod pa de la gzud pa'i phyir don de bstan to //
analyzed: sems can dgrol ba la mnga' brnyes pa dang / sngon gyi dus na dam bcas shing smon lam btab pa de nyid spyod pa dang 'bras bu mthun par gyur pa bzhin sems can thams cad kyang spyod pa de la gzud pa'i phyir don de bstan to //
translated: The teaching of this chapter is for the purpose of engaging all sentient beings in that practice, since the Teacher has attained mastery in liberating sentient beings and his practice and result are in accord with his former commitments and aspirations.

original: de la tshol ba'i rgyu ni mos par bya ba'i le'u las /
analyzed: de la tshol ba'i rgyu ni mos par bya ba'i le'u las /
translated: The cause of seeking is shown in the chapter on interest:

original: nga sngon 'das pa'i dus na dam pa'i chos 'di 'dod pa'i phyir bskal pa mang por skyo mi shes pas tshol zhing sngon rgyal po mdzad pa'i tshe phyogs bzhir dung bus rnga brdungs te chos tshol ba na drang srong las chos mnyan pa'i phyir rim gro bkur sti
analyzed: nga sngon 'das pa'i dus na dam pa'i chos 'di 'dod pa'i phyir bskal pa mang por skyo mi shes pas tshol zhing sngon rgyal po mdzad pa'i tshe phyogs bzhir dung bus rnga brdungs te chos tshol ba na drang srong las chos mnyan pa'i phyir rim gro bkur sti
translated: In the past, when I was a king, I sought the Dharma by blowing a conch and beating a drum in the four directions, and in order to listen to the Dharma from the sages, I served and venerated them for countless eons.

original: grangs med par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las chos thos par tshol ba'i rgyu dang gleng gzhir ston pa'o //
analyzed: grangs med par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las chos thos par tshol ba'i rgyu dang gleng gzhir ston pa'o //
translated: The cause of seeking the Dharma from a spiritual friend is shown in the nidana of hearing the Dharma.

original: de la 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni sngar smos pa'i shin tu zab pa brgyad las dang por sngon sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas brgya stong grangs med pa la rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni sngar smos pa'i shin tu zab pa brgyad las dang por sngon sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas brgya stong grangs med pa la rim gro dang bsnyen bkur byas pa ste /
translated: the Blessed Buddha served and venerated countless hundreds of thousands of buddhas in the past.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gang g'a'i bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas mchod par gyur pa nas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gang g'a'i bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas mchod par gyur pa nas /
translated: This is taught to be extremely profound because the bodhisattvas who have made offerings to as many buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges,

original: rim gyis sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yun ring du 'grogs pa'i phyir mdo 'dzin cing klog pas dbang po drug rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rim gyis sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yun ring du 'grogs pa'i phyir mdo 'dzin cing klog pas dbang po drug rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la rtag tu bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: who have gradually served many buddhas, who have kept company with spiritual friends for a long time, who retain and read the sutras, and whose six senses are therefore pure, and who will constantly serve and venerate many buddhas,

original: 'dzin cing klog pa nyid shin tu zab par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin cing klog pa nyid shin tu zab par bstan to //
translated: retain and read the sutras.

original: de la ltas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa'i 'bras bu brnyes nas mdo sde 'di bshad par dgongs te /
analyzed: de la ltas ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa'i 'bras bu brnyes nas mdo sde 'di bshad par dgongs te /
translated: The signs are that, after the Blessed Buddha attained the unsurpassed result, he thought to teach this sutra.

original: sngar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ltas bstan pa'i phyir lha'i me tog 'brul ba dang / sa rnam par g-yo ba dang / 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pas 'khor mang po zhal du lta zhing dga' ba dang spro ba'i sems kyis deng ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka bshad @176b par dgongs pa'i ltas mang po ston par mdzad pa snyam du sems pa la sogs pa
analyzed: sngar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ltas bstan pa'i phyir lha'i me tog 'brul ba dang / sa rnam par g-yo ba dang / 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pas 'khor mang po zhal du lta zhing dga' ba dang spro ba'i sems kyis deng ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka bshad @176b par dgongs pa'i ltas mang po ston par mdzad pa snyam du sems pa la sogs pa
translated: Previously, for the sake of showing omens to the bodhisattvas, the gods scattered flowers, the earth shook, and light shone, so the great assembly looked to the Bhagavat's face and thought, Now the Bhagavat is showing many omens of intending to explain the excellent Dharma of the Prajnaparamita.

original: bsam pa bskyed pa'i ltas mdo sde gzhan bshad pa dang mi 'dra bar ston pa ni ltas chen po'o //
analyzed: bsam pa bskyed pa'i ltas mdo sde gzhan bshad pa dang mi 'dra bar ston pa ni ltas chen po'o //
translated: The great omen is the teaching of the signs of generating the thought, unlike the explanations in other sutras.

original: de la bshad pa'i rgyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'ang don chen po gcig gi phyir zhes 'byung zhes bya ba nas gnas der nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams med de /
analyzed: de la bshad pa'i rgyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'ang don chen po gcig gi phyir zhes 'byung zhes bya ba nas gnas der nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams med de /
translated: The cause of the explanation is stated as The Tathagata's appearance in the world is for the sake of a single great purpose... up to In that place, there is no assembly of shravakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'ba' zhig la chos ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'ba' zhig la chos ston te /
translated: but only an assembly of bodhisattvas to whom the Dharma is taught.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i bar du 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i bar du rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i bar du 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i bar du rgyas par bstan te /
translated: The text continues with an extensive explanation of the benefits of bodhichitta, from the attainment of the higher realms to the attainment of omniscience.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kun gyis nges pa'i don theg pa chen po ston pa'ang dus dang dbang po smin par ston pa de ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kun gyis nges pa'i don theg pa chen po ston pa'ang dus dang dbang po smin par ston pa de ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas of the three times, the Bhagavans, teach the definitive meaning of the Mahayana, and it is they who teach the proper time and the proper disciples.

original: de la bshad par gleng slong ba ji ltar mdo las gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de la bshad par gleng slong ba ji ltar mdo las gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: The explanation of the benefits of bodhichitta is introduced in the sutra in the following way.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang po bltams pa'i tshe phyogs bzhir gom pa bdun bdun bor te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang po bltams pa'i tshe phyogs bzhir gom pa bdun bdun bor te /
translated: When the Bhagavan was born, he took seven steps in each of the four directions.

original: 'od chen pos phyogs su snang bar mdzad nas kun la seng ge'i sgra sgrogs par dgongs pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad bsgral bar thugs dam bcas te /
analyzed: 'od chen pos phyogs su snang bar mdzad nas kun la seng ge'i sgra sgrogs par dgongs pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can thams cad bsgral bar thugs dam bcas te /
translated: He illuminated the whole of space with a great light and proclaimed the lion‚Äôs roar, promising to deliver all beings without exception.

original: sku khad kyis skyes nas mkhar gyi sgo bzhir gshegs shing 'jig rten gdul ba'i ltas gzigs nas bla na med pa'i lam tshol ba'i phyir khab nas byung zhing dka' thub rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad de /
analyzed: sku khad kyis skyes nas mkhar gyi sgo bzhir gshegs shing 'jig rten gdul ba'i ltas gzigs nas bla na med pa'i lam tshol ba'i phyir khab nas byung zhing dka' thub rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad de /
translated: His body gradually grew, and when he went to the four gates of the palace and saw the signs of the world to be tamed, he left the palace in order to seek the unsurpassed path and practiced various austerities.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas byang chub kyi shing drung du rdo rje gdan la bzhugs pa'i bar 'khor mang por dang po chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas byang chub kyi shing drung du rdo rje gdan la bzhugs pa'i bar 'khor mang por dang po chos ston pa ste /
translated: He attained manifest, perfect buddhahood and sat on the vajra seat at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: dbang po ma smin pa rnams la bkri ba dang bcas pa'i chos ston pa dang / mdo sde 'di ston pa'i dus ni sems can dbang po smin pa rnams la nges pa'i don bstan par dgongs te /
analyzed: dbang po ma smin pa rnams la bkri ba dang bcas pa'i chos ston pa dang / mdo sde 'di ston pa'i dus ni sems can dbang po smin pa rnams la nges pa'i don bstan par dgongs te /
translated: The time when he taught this sutra was when he intended to teach the definitive meaning to beings whose faculties were ripe.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / byams pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gsol ba'i don rnams gcig tu nges par ston pa la sogs pa ni gleng bslang nas chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / byams pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gsol ba'i don rnams gcig tu nges par ston pa la sogs pa ni gleng bslang nas chos ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma with guidance for those whose faculties were not ripe, and the teaching of the Dharma from the introduction onward, such as teaching the meaning of the requests of noble Shariputra, Maitreya Bodhisattva, and youthful Manjushri as a single, definite meaning, and so forth.

original: the tshom bsal ba ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung ston pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: the tshom bsal ba ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung ston pa mdzad kyi /
translated: Dispelling doubts means that when the Bhagavat was fully enlightened, he gave predictions that bodhisattvas would attain complete buddhahood.

original: nyan thos rnams nam du'ang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par lung ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams nam du'ang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par lung ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But he never gave predictions that the sravakas would attain unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos rnams la bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu med do snyam du the tshom du gyur @177a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos rnams la bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu med do snyam du the tshom du gyur @177a * //
translated: Therefore, sravakas such as the noble Sariputra thought, I have no cause for unsurpassable enlightenment.üîΩBodhisattvas also thought, The sravakas have no cause for ever attaining buddhahood.üîΩAnd some of uncertain nature also became doubtful.

original: pa dang ; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang nyan thos rnams nam du yang sangs rgyas su grub pa'i rgyu med pa snyam du sems pa dang / kha cig ma nges pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang the tshom du gyur pa de bsal ba'i phyir mdo sde 'di las nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs te /
analyzed: pa dang ; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang nyan thos rnams nam du yang sangs rgyas su grub pa'i rgyu med pa snyam du sems pa dang / kha cig ma nges pa'i rang bzhin can rnams kyang the tshom du gyur pa de bsal ba'i phyir mdo sde 'di las nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs te /
translated: In order to dispel those doubts, this sutra states that sravakas, bodhisattvas and so on all have the buddha nature.

original: mdo sde 'di la chung du na tshigs su bcad pa gcig thos pa tsam gyis kyang bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung bstan pas de dag gi the tshom bsal to //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la chung du na tshigs su bcad pa gcig thos pa tsam gyis kyang bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung bstan pas de dag gi the tshom bsal to //
translated: The Buddha has also dispelled their doubts by prophesying that they will attain supreme enlightenment by hearing even a single verse of this sutra.

original: de la lung bstan pa dang spyod pa yang dang po mngon par sangs rgyas pa nas de'i bar du nyan thos kyi spyod pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lung ma bstan gyi /
analyzed: de la lung bstan pa dang spyod pa yang dang po mngon par sangs rgyas pa nas de'i bar du nyan thos kyi spyod pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lung ma bstan gyi /
translated: In the first stage of the sutra, the Buddha did not prophesy that they would attain supreme enlightenment by the practice of the disciples, but rather by the practice of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'dir thabs kyis drang ba'i dus la bab par lung bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir thabs kyis drang ba'i dus la bab par lung bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di gsum bsal ba'i phyir dga' bos 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: In order to dispel these three doubts, Nanda said,

analyzed: yang slob dpon gzhan na re dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lhag chad med par mthun par ston pa'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya'o /
translated: Another master says: It is thus because the BhagavƒÅn Buddhas of the three times are in agreement in teaching without addition or omission.üîΩOr, it is thus because the reality of phenomena is the same and not impaired.

translated: Only hearing is mentioned, not seeing and so on, because in order to realize the profound meaning, hearing wisdom precedes, and because in this realm, the Buddha's deeds are performed through sound, so it is called hearing.

original: yang bdag gis thos pa zhes smos pas ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas bshad pa de kho na bzhin smras te /

analyzed: bskyed pa dang skur pa'i mtha' bsal ba'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes smos so //

analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni 'dir dus @183a * // phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //

translated: The time of reasoning is the time of the continuity of the aggregates of the speaker and the listener, which are momentary, arising and ceasing, for as long as the former has not passed and the latter has not arrived.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i dus ni 'chad pa dang nyan pa rnams kyi yid la dus gsum lta bur snang zhing yun ring thung dang nyin mtshan du snang ba de'i dus te /

translated: Just as Vulture Peak is superior to all other mountains, so this vehicle of the One Vehicle is explained there, because it is superior to the two vehicles.üîΩThe assembly of the retinue

translated: The retinue of Indra, king of the gods, and Brahma, and the request by Shariputra, Manjushri, Maitreya, and the Bodhisattva leader to explain the meaning of the sutra twice and three times,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bkri ba'i don ston /

translated: Therefore, he has done what had to be done and accomplished what had to be accomplished.

original: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa'i phyir khur bor ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa'i phyir khur bor ba ste /
translated: Because he has done what had to be done and accomplished what had to be accomplished, he has laid down the burden.

original: lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du gyur pas srid pa phyi ma mi lan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du gyur pas srid pa phyi ma mi lan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because he has realized the truth of the path and the truth of cessation, he will not take up a future existence.

original: srid par sbyor ba'i khur lci ba bor bas rang gi don thob pa yin te mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: srid par sbyor ba'i khur lci ba bor bas rang gi don thob pa yin te mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob ces pa'i don to //
translated: Because he has laid down the heavy burden of the connection to existence, he has attained his own goal, which means he has attained the bliss of nirvana.

original: rang gi don bde ba thob pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu spangs pas srid par sbyor ba thams cad yang mi len te /
analyzed: rang gi don bde ba thob pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu spangs pas srid par sbyor ba thams cad yang mi len te /
translated: Having attained his own goal, the bliss, he does not take up any connection to existence again because he has abandoned the cause of the afflictions.

original: khams gsum du mi skye zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum du mi skye zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means he will not be born in the three realms.

original: zag pa zad pa nyid bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa nyid bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The complete liberation of the mind by the true words of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni mthong bas spang ba yang bsgom pas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal te sems kyi dbang thob pa dang / yon tan gyi mthar thug pas rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni mthong bas spang ba yang bsgom pas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal te sems kyi dbang thob pa dang / yon tan gyi mthar thug pas rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The qualities are perfected means that one perfects the qualities such as supernormal powers and higher perceptions.

original: dbye ba gnyis @186a * //
analyzed: dbye ba gnyis @186a * //
translated: The second is the classification.

original: pa ste ; spyi dang dbye ba bstan pa'i sgo ste kun kyang dgra bcom pa she dag go zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: pa ste ; spyi dang dbye ba bstan pa'i sgo ste kun kyang dgra bcom pa she dag go zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic is all of them are arhats.

original: tshig gi don bco lnga po gzhan ni dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshig gi don bco lnga po gzhan ni dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The other fifteen topics are the specific characteristics.

original: dgra bcom pa'i don ni 'os pa'i don rnam pa bco lnga ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i don ni 'os pa'i don rnam pa bco lnga ste /
translated: The meaning of arhat has fifteen aspects.

original: de la zag pa zad pa'i phyir zhal zas dang khri stan la sogs pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas mchod pa'i zhing du mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa zad pa'i phyir zhal zas dang khri stan la sogs pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas mchod pa'i zhing du mdzes pa'o //
translated: Among them, worthy of offerings means that because the defilements are exhausted, one is worthy of offerings such as food, bedding, and so on, and is thus beautiful as a field of merit.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ston pa la dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ston pa la dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: He is a master in teaching, because he is free from all afflictions.

original: khe dang grags pa tshol ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khe dang grags pa tshol ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is worthy to be engaged, because he is free from seeking profit and fame.

original: 'jug par yang 'os pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug par yang 'os pa ste /
translated: He is worthy to enter,

original: grong dang grong khyer du 'jug na sems kyi dbang du gyur pas 'dod pa'i yul gyis mi bslu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer du 'jug na sems kyi dbang du gyur pas 'dod pa'i yul gyis mi bslu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not deceived by the objects of desire when entering towns and cities, because he is in control of his mind.

original: bdud dang mu stegs 'dul bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs 'dul bar 'os pa ste /
translated: He is worthy to subdue Mara and the tirthikas,

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi spobs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi spobs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is endowed with the eloquence of the knowledge of complete liberation of mind.

original: chos rnams la shes rab myur bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la shes rab myur bar 'os pa ste /
translated: He is worthy to have swift wisdom with regard to phenomena,

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o //
translated: because he is skilled in the characteristics of phenomena due to the complete liberation of wisdom.

original: chos 'chad pa la ha cang myur ba dang bul ba'i skyon dang bral bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa la ha cang myur ba dang bul ba'i skyon dang bral bar 'os pa ste /
translated: He is worthy to be free from the faults of being too quick or slow in explaining the Dharma,üîΩbecause he is skilled in the proper time for teaching the Dharma.

original: chos 'chad pa la mkhas pa 'brel pa skyo ba dang bral ba ji ltar rta cang shes bzhin sems shin tu dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa la mkhas pa 'brel pa skyo ba dang bral ba ji ltar rta cang shes bzhin sems shin tu dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is skilled in teaching the Dharma, because he is not wearied by the connection, and because his mind is well-controlled, like a well-trained horse.

original: gcig pu dben par 'os pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pu dben par 'os pa ste /
translated: He is worthy of living in solitude,

original: zas dang gos la sogs pa yo byad thams cad mi sog mi sdud pas chog shes par gnas pa ni ji ltar glang po che 'du 'dzi dang bral ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zas dang gos la sogs pa yo byad thams cad mi sog mi sdud pas chog shes par gnas pa ni ji ltar glang po che 'du 'dzi dang bral ba bzhin no //
translated: because he is content to live in solitude, not accumulating or storing up any possessions such as food, clothing, etc., like an elephant who is free from worldly attachments.

original: gcig tu na bsam gtan rnams la ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: gcig tu na bsam gtan rnams la ma chags pa ste /
translated: He is not attached to the dhyanas,

original: bya ba byas pas rtag tu bla ma'i sa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byas pas rtag tu bla ma'i sa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is always intent on the stage of the guru, having done what had to be done.

original: rtag tu stong pa nyid kyi spyod pa'i phyir byed pa byas pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu stong pa nyid kyi spyod pa'i phyir byed pa byas pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is free from the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù, because he has done what had to be done, by always practicing emptiness.

original: rtag tu mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas khur lci ba bor ba'i phyir 'gog pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas khur lci ba bor ba'i phyir 'gog pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides in cessation, because he has put down the heavy burden, by always practicing signlessness.

original: rtag tu smon pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rtag tu smon pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas /
translated: He is always practicing wishlessness,

original: rang gi don bde ba thob pa'i phyir 'khor ba la smon pa med par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don bde ba thob pa'i phyir 'khor ba la smon pa med par gnas pa'o //
translated: He abides without aspiration for cyclic existence, in order to attain the bliss of his own aim.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi bsam gtan dga' ba'i ro la chags pa med pa'i phyir srid par sbyor ba yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi bsam gtan dga' ba'i ro la chags pa med pa'i phyir srid par sbyor ba yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: He has abandoned the bonds of existence, because he is not attached to the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration of mundane beings.

original: chos rnams kyi yon tan khyad par can la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yon tan khyad par can la /
translated: He has attained the complete purity of the Dharma, because he has attained the special qualities of the Dharmas.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis rol pa'i phyir bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis rol pa'i phyir bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: He has attained complete liberation of mind through his command of the superknowledges, because he has attained the special qualities of the superknowledges.

original: don dam pa nyid kyi yon tan la bde bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa nyid kyi yon tan la bde bar gnas pa ste /
translated: He abides in the bliss of the ultimate itself, because he has attained the special qualities of the ultimate.

original: sems kyi dbang po @186b thob pas 'dus ma byas la reg pa'i phyir sems kyi dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang po @186b thob pas 'dus ma byas la reg pa'i phyir sems kyi dbang thob pa'o //
translated: He has attained mastery of mind, because he has attained the special qualities of mastery of mind.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has attained the special qualities of benefit for all sentient beings, because he has attained the special qualities of benefit for all sentient beings.

original: bsdu ba'i don ni gong du smos pa'i tshig bco lnga po yon tan bcu ra bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i don ni gong du smos pa'i tshig bco lnga po yon tan bcu ra bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the summary is that the fifteen terms mentioned above should be summarized as the ten qualities.

original: bstan du yod pa'i 'bras bu dang ; bstan du med pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa'i 'bras bu dang ; bstan du med pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result is twofold: the result that is visible and the result that is invisible.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la 'dus byas ni bstan du yod pa 'dus ma byas ni bstan du med pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la 'dus byas ni bstan du yod pa 'dus ma byas ni bstan du med pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the Arhat is twofold: the conditioned result and the unconditioned result.

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu la zag pa zad pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa ni 'ching ba dang bag la nyal ba gnyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu la zag pa zad pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa ni 'ching ba dang bag la nyal ba gnyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The extinction of the contaminants and the absence of the defilements are due to the abandonment of the two bonds and the two dormant tendencies.

original: dbang du gyur pa dang / sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba ni sems dbang du gyur bas 'jig rten gyi yon tan thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa dang / sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba ni sems dbang du gyur bas 'jig rten gyi yon tan thams cad zil gyis mnan te /
translated: The mastery and the liberation of mind and wisdom are due to the mastery of mind, which surpasses all mundane qualities.

original: 'khrug pa sna tshogs zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrug pa sna tshogs zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mastery of mind is due to the pacification of the various disturbances.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: The mastery of wisdom is due to the penetration of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs teaching.

original: rta cang shes lta bu zhi zhing dul ba yid bzhin du dbang du gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: rta cang shes lta bu zhi zhing dul ba yid bzhin du dbang du gyur pa'o ;
translated: The mastery of mind and wisdom is like a well-trained horse, peaceful, disciplined, and obedient.

original: / yon tan khyad par can thob pa ni glang po che ltar gzi brjid che bas mthu dang rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: / yon tan khyad par can thob pa ni glang po che ltar gzi brjid che bas mthu dang rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of special qualities is the perfection of power and of the superknowledges, because of the great majesty like that of the elephant.

original: bya ba byas pa yon tan khyad par can ni bcom ldan 'das la rim gro dang bsti stang byed pa ni yang dag pa'i chos kyi rim gro byed pa yin gyi nor rdzas kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa yon tan khyad par can ni bcom ldan 'das la rim gro dang bsti stang byed pa ni yang dag pa'i chos kyi rim gro byed pa yin gyi nor rdzas kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The special quality of having fulfilled what was to be done is the service and respect rendered to the Lord, which is the service of the true Dharma, not of material things.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni byed pa byas pa rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni byed pa byas pa rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of qualities is the completion of what was to be done.

original: slob pa'i sa rnams rdzogs pas 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa rnams rdzogs pas 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stages of learning are completed, one reaches the end of the truth of cessation.

analyzed: shin tu 'das par gyur pa'i yon tan ni khur bor ba rang gi don thob pa srid pa'i sbyor ba yongs su zad pa ste /

original: yon tan bla ma'i yang bla ma sdud pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi sems rnam par grol bas 'dus ma byas kyi 'bras bu la reg pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The quality of gathering the highest of the high qualities is the quality of touching the unconditioned fruit by means of the mind of perfect wisdom and liberation.

analyzed: bla ma'i yang bla ma'i yon tan sdud pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa ste /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the perfections are completed.üîΩAgain, in the sutra it is said, Thus have I heard... up to the river, Kashyapa.

analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi mchod rten la phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten du bsams te mchod cing rim gro byas na thams cad la rim gro dang mchod pa byas pa yin pa dang / de lta bu'i mtshan nyid du bdag nyid mchod par byad pa dang /
translated: One worships and serves oneself as having such characteristics.

analyzed: rgya chen po'i rim gro dang mchod pa byed pa ni yun ring por mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa ste /

translated: They make offerings and serve with the conduct of the four ways of gathering disciples, with a mind of signlessness that does not waver from remaining in patience and faith in the perfect state for even a moment, and that does not abandon the bodhisattva vows.

original: mdo las lus dang sems byams pas yongs su bsgoms pa nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rtogs pa dag ces pa ni chos de dang de dag la 'jug pa ni byams pa dang snying rje /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'dzin pas phyogs su rnam par grags shing /

translated: They liberate many hundreds of thousands of sentient beings.üîΩThe summary of their distinctive qualities is that they know what they abide in, what their minds abide in, what their transcendent wisdom abides in, what their sphere of activity abides in and what their eloquence abides in.

analyzed: shes rab chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rtogs pa ste /

translated: prƒÅpta is called ‚Äúattained great power‚Äù because he displays great power such as shaking the world, etc., and because he pacifies the suffering of sentient beings in the world in which he appears.

translated: The bodhisattvas Ratnacandra and CandrƒÅrti are so called because they dispel the darkness of ignorance of sentient beings.

analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don las btags pa ste /

translated: The Bodhisattva who is a Savior from Suffering is so named because he bestows the jewel of the mind on sentient beings and establishes them in the peace of nirvana.

analyzed: de la sogs pa dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pa ni bsdus pa'i tshig go //

translated: The ten outer retinue are divided into humans and nonhumans, and the nonhumans are divided into gods and demigods, and the gods are divided into desire realm gods and form realm gods.

analyzed: yang brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / dbang phyug dang gsum mo //

analyzed: mdo las sh'a ri'i bu de tsam zhes pa nas sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mkhyen to zhes pa'i bar du ni tshad med pa'i rnam pa phun sum tshogs pa ston te /

analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir rnam pa tshad med pa mkhyen pa'o //

analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar zhing chud par bya'o // mdo las chos de dag gang yin pa dang zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mngon sum ste /
translated: They should be applied and understood in order.

original: mi mngon pa ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin @211b gshegs pa yang chos thams cad mngon du gzigs shing mkhyen nas chos ston to //
analyzed: mi mngon pa ma yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin @211b gshegs pa yang chos thams cad mngon du gzigs shing mkhyen nas chos ston to //
translated: As for the passage from the sutra that begins with ‚ÄúWhat are those dharmas?‚Äù and ends with ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata himself is manifest, not unmanifest,‚Äù it shows that the TathƒÅgata teaches the Dharma after directly seeing and knowing all dharmas.

original: tshig gi don rnam pa lnga po de ni lan bzhir bzlas te bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don rnam pa lnga po de ni lan bzhir bzlas te bshad par bya'o //
translated: That fivefold meaning should be explained by repeating it four times.

original: de la chos gang yin zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum la 'jug pa bkri ba'i don bsal te nges pa'i don gang yin pa la 'jug pa dang / chos de dag ji lta bu yin pa ni theg pa gcig pu la don rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos gang yin zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum la 'jug pa bkri ba'i don bsal te nges pa'i don gang yin pa la 'jug pa dang / chos de dag ji lta bu yin pa ni theg pa gcig pu la don rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa'o //
translated: The question What is the Dharma? is a clarification of the meaning of the introduction to the three vehicles, and it is an introduction to the definitive meaning. The question What are those Dharmas like? is a teaching of the various aspects of the meaning of the single vehicle.

original: chos de dag ci 'dra ba zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum gyi sgor zhugs pa la spyod pa rnam par dag pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag ci 'dra ba zhes pa ni theg pa rnam gsum gyi sgor zhugs pa la spyod pa rnam par dag pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The question What are those Dharmas like? is the establishment of the pure practice for those who have entered the gateway of the three vehicles.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa ni theg pa rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid gcig tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa ni theg pa rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid gcig tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The question What is the characteristic? is the teaching of the single characteristic of the three kinds of vehicles.

original: ngo bo nyid ci yin pa ni mthar theg pa gcig tu zad de gnyis dang gsum gyi ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ci yin pa ni mthar theg pa gcig tu zad de gnyis dang gsum gyi ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'o //
translated: The question What is the essence? is the teaching that in the end there is only one vehicle, and that there is no essence of two or three.

original: yang 'di man chad tshig de dag las gzhan du grol na chos de dag gang yin zhes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: yang 'di man chad tshig de dag las gzhan du grol na chos de dag gang yin zhes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so //
translated: Moreover, from here on, if one is liberated from those words, the question What are those Dharmas? is the conditioned and unconditioned Dharmas.

original: chos de dag ji lta bu yin pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: chos de dag ji lta bu yin pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ste /
translated: The nature of those phenomena is that which is produced by causes and conditions, and that which is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
translated: Among them, that which is produced by causes and conditions is conditioned phenomena.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'i chos so //
translated: That which is not produced by causes and conditions is unconditioned phenomena.

original: de dag ji 'dra ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de dag ji 'dra ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos te /
translated: Their characteristics are permanent and impermanent phenomena.

original: de yang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ni rtag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de yang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ni rtag pa'i chos so //
translated: Moreover, that which is not produced by conditions is permanent phenomena.

original: rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni mi rtag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rkyen gyis bskyed pa ni mi rtag pa'i chos so //
translated: That which is produced by conditions is impermanent phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid do //üîΩmtshan nyid de gsum dang ldan pa ni 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid do // mtshan nyid de gsum dang ldan pa ni 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i chos so //
translated: The characteristics are the characteristics of phenomena that arise, endure, and perish.üîΩPossessing those three characteristics is conditioned, impermanent phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid de gsum dang bral ba ni 'dus ma byas rtag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gsum dang bral ba ni 'dus ma byas rtag pa'i chos so //
translated: Free from those three characteristics is unconditioned, permanent phenomena.

original: ngo bo nyid ci yin pa ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid dang phung po lnga dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ci yin pa ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid dang phung po lnga dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos te /
translated: The nature of things is the nature of the five aggregates and the nature of the Dharma free from the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The five aggregates have the characteristics of arising, etc.

original: phung po lnga dang bral ba ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga dang bral ba ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'o //

original: yang bshad pa gsum ni tshig de lnga las dang po'i gnyis ni gong du bshad pa dag dang 'dra /
analyzed: yang bshad pa gsum ni tshig de lnga las dang po'i gnyis ni gong du bshad pa dag dang 'dra /

analyzed: chos de dag ci 'dra zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos so //
translated: As for what are those dharmas like?, they are without intrinsic nature, the dharmas of dependent origination.

original: yang chos de dag la bshad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang chos de dag la bshad pa bzhi ste /

translated: It is not like the case of the tƒ´rthikas, who practice their own religion but do not understand reality.

original: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas ngas khyod la bshad do zhes pa'i bar du ni lung bstan dang rnam pa bzhi las nges par lung ston pa dang / khas blang zhing lung ston pa ste de yang sngar ni lung bstan pa rnam gnyis glengs /
analyzed: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas ngas khyod la bshad do zhes pa'i bar du ni lung bstan dang rnam pa bzhi las nges par lung ston pa dang / khas blang zhing lung ston pa ste de yang sngar ni lung bstan pa rnam gnyis glengs /
translated: Previously, the two types of predictions were discussed.

original: de'i 'og tu ni snyigs ma rnam pa lnga dang sbyar /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni snyigs ma rnam pa lnga dang sbyar /

original: the tshom rnam bzhi bstsal ba la 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: the tshom rnam bzhi bstsal ba la 'di ni dang po ste /

analyzed: khas blangs pas lung bstan pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad par gnang ba dang / nga rgyal can gyi rnams bsal bar ston to //
translated: The Lord's permission to explain and the teaching that the proud ones were expelled show that the prophecy was made by the Buddha's acceptance.

original: legs par shin tu nyon la yid la zung shig pa ni dbang po bsdus te bka' nyan du gzung ba'o //
analyzed: legs par shin tu nyon la yid la zung shig pa ni dbang po bsdus te bka' nyan du gzung ba'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind means to listen to the teaching with collected faculties.

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig de gsungs ma thag tu zhes pa nas 'khor de nas dong ngo zhes @216b pa'i bar du ni nga rgyal can gyi rnams dong ba bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig de gsungs ma thag tu zhes pa nas 'khor de nas dong ngo zhes @216b pa'i bar du ni nga rgyal can gyi rnams dong ba bstan to //
translated: The passage from immediately after the Lord spoke those words in the sutra up to they left the assembly shows that the proud ones left.

original: mdo las 'di ltar nga rgyal can gyi zhes pa nas 'khor de nas dong ngo zhes pa'i bar du ni nga rgyal can de dag ci'i phyir dong ba'i gtan tshigs bstan te /

original: thob par dka' ba rnams snga ste /
analyzed: thob par dka' ba rnams snga ste /

original: mi'i lus thob pa dang yul gyi dbus su skye ba dang dbang po tshang pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba mthong ba dang / dam pa'i chos thos pa 'di dag dka' ba las rnyed pa yin na nga rgyal can gyi 'khor 'di rnams ci'i phyir stan la langs te dong ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i lus thob pa dang yul gyi dbus su skye ba dang dbang po tshang pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung ba mthong ba dang / dam pa'i chos thos pa 'di dag dka' ba las rnyed pa yin na nga rgyal can gyi 'khor 'di rnams ci'i phyir stan la langs te dong ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: If it is difficult to obtain a human body, to be born in a central land, to have complete faculties, to be able to see the Tathagata when he appears in the world, and to hear the true Dharma, why do these proud retinues rise from their seats and leave?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir sdig pa'i rnam par smin pa stug pa dang ; nga rgyal can du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir sdig pa'i rnam par smin pa stug pa dang ; nga rgyal can du gyur pa'i phyir te /

original: de nyid rang gi skyon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi skyon du gyur pa'o //

translated: As for the word pride, it is one of seven kinds of pride, and here it is excessive pride and pride of the unreal, since one thinks one has attained what one has not attained.

original: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu ma thob pa dang / 'dus ma byas ma rtogs pas snod du ma gyur pa'i phyir langs te dong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu ma thob pa dang / 'dus ma byas ma rtogs pas snod du ma gyur pa'i phyir langs te dong ngo zhes sbyar ro //

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar bzhugs so zhes pa ni nges pa'i 'bras bu smin pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus kyang bstang ba mi mdzad pa bstan to //

original: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas de'i don bshad do zhes pa'i bar du ni 'khor ma brtags pa bsal te /
analyzed: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa nas de'i don bshad do zhes pa'i bar du ni 'khor ma brtags pa bsal te /

analyzed: snod du gyur pa 'khor dam pa nyi tshe la chos bshad par dgongs pa'o //

translated: The single great purpose is

analyzed: de la ming bstan pa ni rnyog pa ste /

The teaching concerning the name. The defilement is called ‚Äúturbidity‚Äù because it is the cause of the impurity of the water of the Dharma Body.

translated: In brief, at the beginning of the aeon, the aeon of creation, the three aeons are gradually filled up.

original: nyon mongs pa ni khad kyis bsrabs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni khad kyis bsrabs te /

analyzed: de la mtshan nyid bstan pa ni 'grel pa las da ltar gyi mi rnams rab tu tshe thung ste lo brgya las mi 'da' ba ni tshe'i rnyog pa zhes bya ste /

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bag chags kyi rnam pas las tha dad par gyur pa ni tshe'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bag chags kyi rnam pas las tha dad par gyur pa ni tshe'i dbang po'i mtshan nyid do //

original: dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i mthu zhan par gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i mthu zhan par gyur te /

translated: Those sentient beings who do not recognize their parents, who do not recognize ascetics and brahmins, who do not recognize their elders, who do not know the Dharma, who are not afraid of the ripening of karma in this world and the next,

original: sbyin pa mi byed @221a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi byed @221a * //

translated: Sentient beings who are attached to what is not Dharma, who give weapons and articles that harm sentient beings, who delight in fighting and quarreling, who are deceitful and deceptive, who hold wrong views and practice non-virtuous dharmas, are called the turbidity of afflictions.

original: lta ba lnga ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //

original: chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi mtshon cha la sogs pa byin te gsod du bcug pa dang / nor rdzas la chags te mtshon cha byin pas 'thab cing rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / gzhan yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos su gtogs pa nyon mongs pa dang /

analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bag chags kyi dbang gis nyon mongs pa skye ba dang / 'jig rten na dam pa'i chos nub ste /

analyzed: nam gzugs brnyan tsam la spyad pa log par lta ba skyes pa ni lta ba'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //

original: de la bskal pa'i rnyog pa dang sems can gyi rnyog pa'i gnyen po ni 'jig rten gyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de la bskal pa'i rnyog pa dang sems can gyi rnyog pa'i gnyen po ni 'jig rten gyi grub pa'i mtha'o //

analyzed: tshe'i rnyog pa'i gnyen po ni dbang po so so'i grub pa'i mtha'o //

original: grub pa'i mtha' gsum gyis rnyog pa lnga bcom nas don dam par zhugs te yang dag pa nyid ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gsum gyis rnyog pa lnga bcom nas don dam par zhugs te yang dag pa nyid ni rig pa'o //
translated: Having conquered the five defilements with the three philosophies, one enters into the ultimate and knows reality.

original: de la gzugs pa dang gzhig pa ni dris pa /
analyzed: de la gzugs pa dang gzhig pa ni dris pa /
translated: Here, the question is asked: What is the form and what is the destruction?

original: ci'i phyir rnyog pa lnga las mi mang mi nyung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnyog pa lnga las mi mang mi nyung zhe na /
translated: Why are there not more than five defilements, not less?

original: lan btab pa /
analyzed: lan btab pa /
translated: The answer is given:

original: sems can la rnam pa gnyis @221b te ;
analyzed: sems can la rnam pa gnyis @221b te ;
translated: Sentient beings are of two kinds:

original: sdig pa spyod pa khyim pa skye bo dang log par lta ba ste rab tu byung ba'i mu stegs can no //
analyzed: sdig pa spyod pa khyim pa skye bo dang log par lta ba ste rab tu byung ba'i mu stegs can no //
translated: those who practice evil, the lay people, and those who have wrong views, the non-Buddhist renunciates.

original: khyim pa shis pa med pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa shis pa med pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The lay people who are unlucky and generate afflictions are called the defilement of afflictions.

original: mu stegs can la log par lta ba don med pa tshol ba ni lta ba'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can la log par lta ba don med pa tshol ba ni lta ba'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas‚Äô useless search for a wrong view is called the turbidity of views.

original: gzhan yang dbang po rtul po ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po rtul po ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya /
translated: Moreover, those of dull faculties are called the turbidity of afflictions.

original: dbang po rnon po ni lta ba'i rnyog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni lta ba'i rnyog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those of sharp faculties are called the turbidity of views.

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i tshe bsdu ba dang dbye ba mi mthun pas rnyog pa rnam gnyis su phye ste nang gi 'bras bu gnyis dang spyir bsdu ba ni sems can gyi rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i tshe bsdu ba dang dbye ba mi mthun pas rnyog pa rnam gnyis su phye ste nang gi 'bras bu gnyis dang spyir bsdu ba ni sems can gyi rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Due to two causes, when the future result is obtained, it is divided into two turbidities because it is not compatible with the collection and division. The two internal results and the general collection are called the turbidity of sentient beings.

original: sems can sdig pa phyi'i 'bras bu gnyis dang spyir bsdus pa ni bskal pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can sdig pa phyi'i 'bras bu gnyis dang spyir bsdus pa ni bskal pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The two external results and the general collection of sentient beings‚Äô sins are called the turbidity of eons.

original: rtsa ba bstan pa'am /üîΩnang gi mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ni tshe'i rnyog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rtsa ba bstan pa'am / nang gi mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ni tshe'i rnyog pa zhes bya /
translated: The explanation of the rootüîΩThe internal result of nonvirtue is called the turbidity of lifespan.

original: phyi rol gyi mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ni bskal pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mi dge ba'i 'bras bu ni bskal pa'i rnyog pa zhes bya /
translated: The external result of nonvirtue is called the turbidity of eons.

original: sdig pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sems can sdig pa las yod par 'gyur bas sems can gyi rnyog pa zhes bya ste de bas na rnyog pa lnga'i mtshan nyid bstan pas de la skyo bar bya ba'i phyir rnyog pa lnga bshad do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu sems can sdig pa las yod par 'gyur bas sems can gyi rnyog pa zhes bya ste de bas na rnyog pa lnga'i mtshan nyid bstan pas de la skyo bar bya ba'i phyir rnyog pa lnga bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the five turbidities are explained in order to generate disgust for them by teaching the characteristics of the five turbidities.

original: de la gcig gis gcig bsdu ba ni mdo dag las rnyog pa bcu gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gcig gis gcig bsdu ba ni mdo dag las rnyog pa bcu gnyis gsungs te /
translated: The inclusion of one in the other is that the s≈´tras teach twelve turbidities:

original: bskal pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / dus kyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang ; sems can gyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / tshe'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / theg pa gsum gyi khyad par gyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / dus kyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang ; sems can gyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / tshe'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / theg pa gsum gyi khyad par gyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang /
translated: the teaching of the turbidity of eons, the teaching of the turbidity of time, the teaching of the turbidity of sentient beings, the teaching of the turbidity of afflictions, the teaching of the turbidity of lifespan, the teaching of the turbidity of the three vehicles,

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing gi rnyog pa bstan pa dang / sems can gdul dka' ba'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / mu stegs can 'khrug pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / bdud kyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing gi rnyog pa bstan pa dang / sems can gdul dka' ba'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / mu stegs can 'khrug pa'i rnyog pa bstan pa dang / bdud kyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang /
translated: The twelve defilements are: the defilement of the world, the defilement of sentient beings, the defilement of afflictions, the defilement of tirthikas, the defilement of maras,

original: bdud kyi las kyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi rnyog pa bstan pa dang bcu gnyis so //
translated: the defilement of maras' actions, the defilement of views, the defilement of the five degenerations, the defilement of the five degenerations of sentient beings, the defilement of the five degenerations of lifespan, the defilement of the five degenerations of afflictions, and the defilement of the five degenerations of views.

original: rnyog pa bcu gnyis po 'di sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na theg pa chen po pa 'ba' zhig la yod do //
analyzed: rnyog pa bcu gnyis po 'di sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na theg pa chen po pa 'ba' zhig la yod do //
translated: These twelve defilements exist in the emanated buddha-fields only for those of the Mahayana.

original: rnyog pa lnga'i yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing na theg pa che chung gnyi ga la yod do //
analyzed: rnyog pa lnga'i yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing na theg pa che chung gnyi ga la yod do //
translated: In the impure buddha-fields with five defilements, they exist for both the Mahayana and Hinayana.üîΩThe defilement of eons and time, the defilement of sentient beings and difficult to tame sentient beings, the defilement of afflictions and various afflictions,

original: bskal pa dang dus ni bskal pa'i rnyog pa sems can dang gdul dka' ba'i sems can ni sems can gyi rnyog pa nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa sna tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa /
analyzed: bskal pa dang dus ni bskal pa'i rnyog pa sems can dang gdul dka' ba'i sems can ni sems can gyi rnyog pa nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa sna tshogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa /
translated: are the defilements of sentient beings, afflictions, and various afflictions.

original: tshe ni tshe'i rnyog pa /
analyzed: tshe ni tshe'i rnyog pa /
translated: Lifespan is the defilement of lifespan.

original: mu stegs can 'khrug pa ni lta ba'i @222a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can 'khrug pa ni lta ba'i @222a * //
translated: The tirthikas are agitated by views.üîΩ

original: rnyog pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa ste /
translated: The agitation of the tirthikas is the agitation of views.

original: brgyad po 'di ni rnyog pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di ni rnyog pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: These eight are the five agitations.

original: lhag ma bzhi po ni theg pa gsum gyi khyad par du bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi po ni theg pa gsum gyi khyad par du bstan to //
translated: The remaining four are taught as the distinctions of the three vehicles.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing na bdud dang bdud kyi las ni rnyog pa lngar mi bsdu'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i zhing na bdud dang bdud kyi las ni rnyog pa lngar mi bsdu'o //
translated: In a completely impure land, Mara and the activities of Mara are not included in the five agitations.

original: 'grel pa las rnam par dag pa ni rnyog pa ma yin pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'grel pa las rnam par dag pa ni rnyog pa ma yin pa'i don te /
translated: In the commentary, purity is said to be the opposite of agitation.

original: rnyog pa la yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa la yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Agitation is of six kinds:

original: rnyog pa 'di dang bral na rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa 'di dang bral na rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When free from these agitations, it is called purity.

original: drug gang zhe na chags pa'i rnyog pa dang / spyod lam gyi rnyog pa dang / sgrib pa'i rnyog pa dang / mtshan ma tha dad pa'i rnyog pa dang / yon tan dang mi ldan pa'i rnyog pa dang / gti mug gi rnyog pa dang drug go //
analyzed: drug gang zhe na chags pa'i rnyog pa dang / spyod lam gyi rnyog pa dang / sgrib pa'i rnyog pa dang / mtshan ma tha dad pa'i rnyog pa dang / yon tan dang mi ldan pa'i rnyog pa dang / gti mug gi rnyog pa dang drug go //
translated: What are the six? The agitation of attachment, the agitation of conduct, the agitation of obscurations, the agitation of different signs, the agitation of lacking good qualities, and the agitation of delusion.

original: gnyen po'i phyir le lo spang ba'i phyir dag pa'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir bsod nams dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyir le lo spang ba'i phyir dag pa'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir bsod nams dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of the antidote, in order to abandon laziness, for the sake of purification, for the sake of teaching, for the sake of possessing merit,

original: ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir gnyen po 'di drug dang zag pa drug go rims su sbyar ro //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir gnyen po 'di drug dang zag pa drug go rims su sbyar ro //
translated: and for the sake of possessing intuition, these six antidotes are to be connected with the six corruptions in the proper order.

original: chos nyid sangs rgyas ni rnyog pa lnga'i tshe 'jig rten du gshegs te de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rnyog pa lnga'i dus su 'jig rten du gshegs so //
analyzed: chos nyid sangs rgyas ni rnyog pa lnga'i tshe 'jig rten du gshegs te de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rnyog pa lnga'i dus su 'jig rten du gshegs so //
translated: The Buddha of reality appeared in the world at the time of the five corruptions. Therefore, the Lord Buddha appeared in the world at the time of the five corruptions.

original: ci'i phyir byams pa ni tshe lo brgyad khri'i dus su gshegs la sh'a kya thub pa ni tshe lo brgya'i dus su gshegs par gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byams pa ni tshe lo brgyad khri'i dus su gshegs la sh'a kya thub pa ni tshe lo brgya'i dus su gshegs par gyur /
translated: Why did Maitreya appear at the time of the life-span of eighty thousand years, and Shakyamuni appear at the time of the life-span of one hundred years?

original: smras pa / smon lam ni tha dad kyi gnyi ga yang rnyog pa lnga'i dus su gshegs par 'dra bar sngar theg pa gsum thabs tsam du bstan nas phyis yang dag pa bstan te //
analyzed: smras pa / smon lam ni tha dad kyi gnyi ga yang rnyog pa lnga'i dus su gshegs par 'dra bar sngar theg pa gsum thabs tsam du bstan nas phyis yang dag pa bstan te //
translated: It is said that their vows were different, but both appeared at the time of the five corruptions. Having previously taught the three vehicles as mere expedients, he later taught the true one.

original: sprul pa'i sku la 'dra'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku la 'dra'o //
translated: This is the same for the emanation body.

original: gal te bsod nams kyi sku dang / sprul pa'i sku la theg pa gnyis po la 'dul ba mi mdzad na nges par rnyog pa ma yin pa'i dus su gshegs nas theg pa gnyis po la gdul bar mdzad pas nges par rnyog pa'i dus su gshegs so //
analyzed: gal te bsod nams kyi sku dang / sprul pa'i sku la theg pa gnyis po la 'dul ba mi mdzad na nges par rnyog pa ma yin pa'i dus su gshegs nas theg pa gnyis po la gdul bar mdzad pas nges par rnyog pa'i dus su gshegs so //
translated: If the Body of Merit and the Emanation Body did not train in the two vehicles, they would not have come at a time of defilement, but would have come at a time of no defilement and trained in the two vehicles.

original: rnyog pa zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa'i bskal ba las 'jug ste rnyog pa lnga khad kyis skye bas de la rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa'i bskal ba las 'jug ste rnyog pa lnga khad kyis skye bas de la rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called defilement begins with the eon of destruction. Since the five defilements gradually arise, it is called defilement.

original: sangs rgyas byams pa gshegs pa'i tshe lo brgyad khri las khad kyis bri bas de la yang rnyog pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i tshe lo bcu'am nyi shu las mi thub pa'i bskal pa chung ngu 'byung ba 'ba' zhig la rnyog pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byams pa gshegs pa'i tshe lo brgyad khri las khad kyis bri bas de la yang rnyog pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i tshe lo bcu'am nyi shu las mi thub pa'i bskal pa chung ngu 'byung ba 'ba' zhig la rnyog pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: When the Buddha Maitreya comes, the life span will gradually decrease from eighty thousand years. At that time, a small eon called the time of defilement will occur, where it is impossible to live for more than ten or twenty years. It is not only that time that is called defilement.
